subject: Economics
title: AI and the Future of Work: Complement or Replacement?
description: A short lesson to help you apply AI and the Future of Work: Complement or Replacement?.

hook.text: ChatGPT can write legal briefs, code software, and diagnose diseases. But lawyers, programmers, and doctors still exist.

buildup.text: Will AI complement human work (making workers more productive) or substitute it (replacing workers entirely)?

discovery.text: History suggests complement: ATMs made bank tellers focus on sales, not cash counting.

twist.text: But generative AI is different: it performs the creative, cognitive tasks that were supposed to be automation-proof.

climax.text: The most likely outcome: AI transforms every job rather than eliminating them.

punchline.text: AI won't replace you. Someone using AI will.

quiz.question: Why is generative AI different from previous automation waves?
options: It can perform creative and cognitive tasks ‚Äî writing, coding, art ‚Äî that were previously considered uniquely human and automation-proof
